doc.title: A House Divided
doc.plot: Radical racial separatist groups, both black and white -- including the KKK, White Aryan Resistance, the Pan African Inter-Nationalist (PAIN) movement -- are explored in this disturbing look at the extremes of racialist thought. The film climaxes with a joint rally in favor of racial separation staged by the Klan and members of PAIN on the site of the first slave market in the United States in the town square of St. Augustine, Florida.
